Description: Fragment of oval, tapering handle of a Rhodian pottery transport amphora at neck join to sharpish turn. Clay fine pink-brown; cream slip. Rectangular stamp with 'Helios symbol' symbol.
Production date: 200 BC (see N. Badoud, Le temps de Rhodes (2015) 142.)
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Great Temenos, In a trench located just outside the Great Temenos
Curator's comments: Griffith drew a sketch of a similar stamp in his notes (Petrie Notebook 150 - original in the Petrie Museum- entry by Griffith for 7 January 1885). The stamped handle was discovered in a large votive deposit of Egyptian objects mainly in a trench made outside the Great Temenos. For a relatively similar stamp, see 1925,0119.475.b.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (JB.0639)
